gui.stockmarket.trade_screen.title: Stock Market Block
message.stockmarket.marketplace_is_now_c: Marketplace for all items is now closed
message.stockmarket.marketplace_is_now_o: Marketplace for {item_name} is now open for trading
Marketplace for all tradable items is now open for trading
message.stockmarket.marketplace_deleted: {item_name} can no longer be traded on the stock market
message.stockmarket.marketplace_created: {item_name} can now be traded on the stock market
message.stockmarket.order_not_replaced: Order can not be placed to a new price
message.stockmarket.order_replaced: Order successfully placed to a new price
message.stockmarket.can_not_create_defau: Can not create default bot for item: {item_name}
Can not create default bots for category: {value}
message.stockmarket.bot_created: Bot created for item: {item_name}, you can change its settings and than enable it
message.stockmarket.bot_setting_volatili: Max volatility Timer time set to {value}ms
Min volatility Timer time set to {value}ms
message.stockmarket.bot_setting_volume_s: The trading volume scale is set to {value}
message.stockmarket.bot_setting_imbalanc: Target price change factor set to {value}
Target price quadratic change factor set to {value}
message.stockmarket.insufficient_fund_to: Insufficient funds to buy {amount} {item_name} for a price of {price} {currency} each
message.stockmarket.order_invalid_reason: Not enough orders to fill the {buy_sell_direction} market order
message.stockmarket.need_creative_mode_f: You need to be in creative mode to access this screen
gui.stockmarket.management_screen.title: Stock Market Management
gui.stockmarket.management_screen.ask_re:
Are you sure you want to remove the selected pair from the stockmarket?
All open Orders will be closed and the market bot will be deleted.
gui.stockmarket.management_screen.genera:
Closes all markets so that players no longer can place orders.
This is useful when you want to change settings of the market and
prevent players from exploiting strong changes in price due to changing settings.
Or if things get out of hand and you need a quick way to close all markets.
Opens all markets so that players can place orders again.

Resets the historical data for all markets.
All charts will be reset to the current market price.
This is useful when you want to start fresh with the markets,
or if you want to reset the price chart after a big market crash.

Do you really want to reset the price chart for all markets?
This will reset all historical data and all charts will be reset
to the current market price.
This can not be undone!

Do you really want to delete all markets?
This will remove all markets and all bots.
All open orders will be closed and the market data will be lost.
This can not be undone!
gui.stockmarket.trade_panel.amount:
The amount of {item_name}
you want to buy or sell.
gui.stockmarket.trade_panel.limit_price:
The price you want to
buy or sell {item_name} for.
It is only used for limit orders.
gui.stockmarket.trade_panel.tooltip_mark:
A market order is an order to buy or sell
an item at the current market price.
The order will be filled immediately,
if there is enough volume available on the market.
gui.stockmarket.trade_panel.tooltip_limi:
A limit order is an order to buy or sell
an item at a specific price.
The order will only be filled
if the market price reaches the specified price.
gui.stockmarket.trading_chart_widget.too:
Shows a histogram for how much liquidity is available in the orderbook.
The wider the bars, the more volume is available at a specific price.

Visualizes the volume of the last trades.
The higher the bar, the more volume was
traded in the specific time span.
gui.stockmarket.orderlistview.filled:
The amount of the order that has already been filled.
For buy orders: The amount of items you have already received.
For sell orders: The amount of items you have already sold.
gui.stockmarket.limit_order_in_chart_dis:
Move Order to a new price
by drag and drop.
gui.stockmarket.trading_pair_creation_sc: Failed to create market for {item_name} with currency {currency}

{item_name} will be traded for
{price} {currency} each, in the beginning.

The market will be open for trading after creation.
You can close it later in the management screen.

Create the market for the selected item and currency.
You can change the settings later in the management screen.
The volatility of the market is set to {value}.

Value that represents how often the item occurs in nature,
or how easy it is to get access to it.
The rarity of the market is set to {value}.

Time how fast the Bot will trade.
The market speed is set to {value}. ({amount} ms)
gui.stockmarket.market_settings_screen.g:
If set, players are allowed to trade on the market.
Close the market when you play with the settings
to prevent players from exploiting strong
changes in price due to changing settings.
Each candlestick represents a time span of {amount} minutes.
gui.stockmarket.market_settings_screen.v:
The virtual order book adds realistic liquidity to
the market and is strongly recommended.
Without it, players may not be able to buy/sell items
because there may not be enough liquidity available.

Factor to scale the volume distribution in the order book.
Large values will result in a more robust market where a player
needs more capital to move the price.

Factor to scale the volume distribution in
the order book close around the current market price.
Large values will result in a more robust market where a player
needs more capital to move the price.

Determines how fast the order book accumulates volume,
after some volume was consumed by orders.

Determines how fast the order book accumulates volume,
after a large chunk of volume was consumed by orders.

Determines how fast the order book decumulates volume,
to match the target volume distribution.
gui.stockmarket.market_settings_screen.b: The market bot will bring some randomness to the price chart.

Default price for the item, used to calculate the target price of the bot.
The bot moves the market price towards the calculated target price.

Interval in milliseconds for how often the bot will execute an order.
Low values result in a more responsive bot but
may impact the server performance

Order volume scale factor for the bot.
With a large value, the bot orders will be larger and
therefore can move the price more strongly.

The bot will try to keep the price
at its calculated target price.

Factor on how strong the bot trys
to reach the calculated target price.

The bot will track the buy/sell volume.
This value is used to calculate the target price.
Example: If many players sell dirt in huge quantities,
the bot will lower the target price to make it less attractive to sell.
When players then buy back, the bot will rise the price again.

Factor to define how strong the bot moves the price,
based on the trade volume imbalance created by players.

The bot will randomly change the target price
using a random walk generator.

Factor to define how volatile the market is.
Higher values result in a more volatile market,
where the price changes more often and stronger.
gui.stockmarket.market_creation_by_categ: Creates all markets in the list above
Add the market to the list of markets to create.
Remove the market from the list of markets to create.
